intro: Neoscortechinia arborea, commonly known as the tree of heaven, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, featuring a straight trunk and a broad, rounded crown. The leaves are alternate, simple, and ovate with a smooth margin. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, arranged in clusters, while the fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. This plant is native to South America but has been introduced to various parts of the world, often becoming invasive in new habitats.
